Contains the alpha code identifying the type of action which has resulted in the position movement. Possible codes are: INP - Input of transaction DEL - Deletion of position update REV - Reversal of transaction MAT - Maturity of position (date is cycled to next day) MRG - Merge of yesterday's position into today RLL - Revaluation of Local position

The date on which the entry is to be given value for interest purposes. Not used for Entries over Internal Accounts.
If the Value Date is not entered in the originating transaction, a default date may be generated by the system depending on rules specified in the application or the Transaction code record.
If it is neither input nor generated, the Value Date is assumed to be the same as the BOOKING DATE, Field 25.

Example:
If a foreign exchange deal is entered as :-
Buy CCy ITL Sell CCy JPY Buy Amount 1,000,000 Sell Amount 5,000,000
Assume deal entered in company NG0010001, currency market 1 is used, position type is trading (TR), and value date of deal is 19930325
Then the following two position records will be raised :-
Position id - NG00100011TR25ITLJPY19930325*12345.00
Position id - NG00100011TR25JPYITL19930325*12345.00

Note: All foreign exchange transfers arising from non FX applications, ie. Funds Transfer, Tellere, etc, will create four position records, one for bought currency against local, one for local against bought currency, one for sold currency against local, and one for local against sold currency. Only Foreign Exchange deals will maintain cross currency positions, wheras all other applications will maintain positions against the local currency.
This file is for display purposes only, no input is allowed.
Unique key identifying the position record.
The POSITION ID is made up of the following structure :- [CO][CM][PT][DD][B.CCY][S.CCY][V.DATE] * [SSSSS] . [99] Where:

CO - Company Code (eg NG0010001) CM - Currency Market PT - Position Type DD - Dealer Desk B.CCY - Bought Currency S.CCY - Sold Currency V.DATE - Value date SSSSS - Seconds since midnight 99 - sequence number from 1 to 99

Each time a deal or process that generates cross currency entries is entered into the system, then the above position id is made up from the transaction details, and this record will either be updated or created.
